titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the O. J. (Oliver Julian) Todd papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Pruda L. Lood

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-30T12:06-0800

change.item: Revised to add microfilm reel instances and move box/folder info into scope and contents notes. - Paige Davenport
Added links for materials on digitalcollections.hoover.org.

Revised after motion picture film reel 3 deaccessioned due to severe nitrate decomposition and health and safety hazards. August 2013: Revised after transfer of manuscript boxes to SAL3. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::O. J. (Oliver Julian) Todd Papers)//EN" "reg_006.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Diaries, speeches and writings, correspondence, reports, memoranda, and photographs relating to engineering projects in China, especially river engineering and flood control; famines and relief work in China; and social, economic and political conditions in China. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Microfilm use only, except boxes 58 and 60-63. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Oliver Julian Todd papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Available on microfilm (82 reels). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

chronitem.event: B.S. degree in Civil Engineering, University of Michigan
Field Assistant, Chief Hydrographer, and Assistant Engineer for the City of San Francisco; worked on the Hetch Hetchy water supply system and the Twin Peaks Tunnel
Captain in the Engineering Corps, U.S. Army
Principal Assistant Engineer for the Chinese government's Grand Canal Improvement Board
Field Manager and Chief Engineer for American National Red Cross in Shantung (4 months)
Chief Engineer for the Asia Development Company
Chief Engineer for the China International Famine Relief Commission

Consulting Engineer to the China International Famine Relief Commission, to the American Advisory Board of Shanghai, to the Shantung Government on the Yellow River, to the Yellow River Commission, and to the Friendship Fund of New York City
Returned to the United States and settled in Palo Alto, California
Engineer for the U.S. Bureau of Reclamation
Regional Engineer, Area Engineer and Senior Engineer with the United States Army Engineers in Arizona
Advisor to the Yellow River Project of the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration in China
Democratic candidate for U.S. Congress in the 8th District
Chief of the Irrigation Engineering Division of the Joint Commission on Rural Reconstruction in China
Author, The China That I Knew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Diaries, speeches and writings, correspondence, reports, memoranda, and photographs relating to engineering projects in China, especially river engineering and flood control; famines and relief work in China; and social, economic and political conditions in China.

controlaccess.corpname: United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration.
controlaccess.subject: Engineering--China.
Famines--China.
Flood control--China.
International relief.
Reconstruction (1939-1951)--China.
River engineering--China.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Circa 7,000 photographs, slides, post cards and moving pictures relating to Todd and family members, China, China leaders, and all phases of his work on the water systems at Hetch Hetchy, China's Yellow River and in Taiwan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box 59 on microfilm reel 78. Box 60 not filmed. Contains 48 booklets of detachable post cards; 647 individual cards and 3 packets of cards and one duplicate, depicting scenes, cities, buildings and artwork in Belgium, China, France, Hong Kong, Italy, Taiwan, the United Kingdom and the United States.

did.unittitle: One stereoscope and 100 slides of a set titled "Editions Stereoscopeques de Guerre" depicting war damage,
84 glass slides depicting Yellow River projects in China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See also photographs of irrigation and dike work in progress, with dates and captions, in these series: AMERICAN NATIONAL RED CROSS and ASIA DEVELOPMENT COMPANY; CHINA INTERNATIONAL FAMINE RELIEF COMMISSION; and UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND REHABILITATION ADMINISTRATION. See also SPEECHES AND WRITINGS, The Open Road in China, where photographs accompany the text.

did.unittitle: 6 prints, 7 duplicates and 1 negative depicting Todd only

3 prints, 2 duplicates and 2 negatives depicting a centrifugal pump at the Satochu Works, Saratsi

48 prints and one duplicate depicting villages, and refugees in the flooded area of Li Chin, Shantung
88 prints, 20 duplicates and 142 negatives depicting dike closure work using kao-liang "sausages" in Shantung
128 prints and 20 duplicates depicting scenes throughout Shensi Province, and work on the Yellow River, the Yi Ho and the Wei Ho
60 prints and 30 duplicates depicting work on the Wei Pei Project, Shensi Province

65 prints, 1 duplicate and 36 negatives depicting roads and a Fen Ho bridge in Shansi Province

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box 75. 23 prints depicting University of Michigan classmates of Todd; staff members of the Asia Development Company, American National Red Cross, and the China International Famine Relief Commission; and Chinese leaders.
